com.ibm.team.repository.client

Interface IItemManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IEventSource

    public interface IItemManager
extends IEventSource
    An item manager for a particular team repository.

    The item manager is a generic event source for events of type ISharedItemChangeEvent. Its parent event source is ITeamRepository.

    There are two main subgroups of methods. Methods with names matching fetch{complete|partial}Item[s] retrieve the current state of a simple or auditable item. These methods normally return shared items that track an item's progress as it changes (unless the UNSHARED flag is passed). Methods with names matching fetch{complete|partial}State[s] retrieve the specified state of an auditable item. These methods return immutable item states.

    Shared items are managed by an item manager. The first time a client asks for the shared item for a particular item, the item manager fetches the current state of the item from the repository. The item manager then creates a new item instance of the same type and item id, called the shared item instance, and sets its properties to match the current values just retrieved. The item manager returns the shared item, but also hangs on to a (weak) reference to it internally. When the item manager is subsequently asked for the shared item for the same particular item, it returns the shared item without contacting the server. So the item manager acts as the central clearinghouse from shared items, and acts like a client-side item cache. Component-specific operations that save new states of an item generally inform the item manager so that it can update the corresponding shared item in-place to match, and sends out event notifications to interested parties.

    The shared item will have the same property values as the last-known current state of the item in the repository. A shared item can become stale if the item is concurrently updated in the repository by another client. Usually its now a big problem to work with slightly stale data, given the cost of round-trips to the server. However, in some cases (such as opening an editor) it is important to be up-to-date; use the REFRESH flag to force the server to be contacted for the absolute latest state of the item in the repository.

    Shared items are read-only to the client. Nevertheless, the shared items properties change value whenever the item manager becomes aware of a new state of the item. So they are not immutable. Under the covers, a shared item is a dynamic proxy that wraps an immutable item state that forwards all calls to it. The shared item points to different immutable item states over its lifetime. The immutable item states themselves are never modified. The only thing that changes is the single IItem reference field in the wrapper. The method getImmutableState(IItem) returns the immutable item state hidden within the wrapper.

    Reading the properties of a shared item: From a client point of view, shared items are thread-safe. The client can read properties from a shared item without risk of corrupting the shared item or the item manager. Client that reads properties from a shared item should ensure that they are working from a consistent picture even if the shared item happens to get updated concurrently. They do this by calling getImmutableState to obtain an immutable item state, and then accessing its fields at their leisure.

    Modifying the properties of a shared item: Shared items are read-only to clients; only the item manager itself is allowed to create new shared items or modify the properties of existing ones.

    Partial vs complete: The client specifies whether they are interested in the complete item or in just a subset of the item's properties. The fetchCompleteItem(IItemHandle, int, IProgressMonitor) method normally returns a shared item that is fully fleshed out with the current values for all its properties. On the other hand, the fetchPartialItem(IItemHandle, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor) indicated that the client is saying that they are only interested in a subset of the item's properties given by the requiredProperties parameter, or the default set of item properties if requiredProperties = null. These latter methods normally return partial shared items.

    When a client asks for a shared item, it should generally hang on to the shared item until it is done with it. The shared item will continue to have current values for all the properties it requested.

    The default set of item properties is a function of each different item type. For some items types, the default set always includes all properties of the item, making it fully equivalent to retrieving a complete shared item. Other item types will define the default to be a subset of the item type's properties. See the documentation for each item type to find out whether the default set of properties is specified.

    When several clients all ask for the shared item for a given item id, the item manager gives them all the same shared item instance. There is only one shared item instance for a given item id and item manager. Each of these client may state that they require a different set of properties. The item manager satisfies all these requests simultaneously by ensuring that the shared item has (at least) the union of the required properties across all clients. New clients that come along and request only properties that have the existing shared item already has are given the shared item without further ado. Ones that request a property that the existing shared item does not currently have block while the shared item is upgraded, which entails retrieving current values of additional properties of the item from the repository and merging the values in to the shared instance. (The component that owns the item type has a way to influence how upgrading is carried out for a particular item. For instance, it could decide that enough of the item's properties have been retrieved that it would be better to retrieve the complete item and be done with it.)

    Within the same item manager, listeners can be registered against specific shared items or all shared items of a given item type. When the same listener instance is registered against multiple items or item types with the same item manager, it will only be invoked once for any given event. The listener will see the events in the order in which they occurred to that item manager. But when a listener instance that is registered against more than one item manager instance, it will receives the event notifications from the different item managers in unspecified order (including concurrent deliveries from multiple threads).

    Listeners are notified when an item manager creates a shared item. This includes both retrieving an existing item as well as creating a brand new item in the repository.

    Listeners are notified when an item manager discovers (or is informed) that an item has been deleted from the repository. This happen when the item manager re-retrieves an existing shared item and finds that it is no longer present in the repository, or when it is informed of the deletion via applyItemDeletes(List).

    Shared items are eligible to be garbage collected once the client has dropped all references to the shared item instance. Conversely, by hanging on to a reference to a shared item, the client is assured that the method will return the identical instance with no server round trip.

    Items returned by the methods on this interface will have their origin set to the repository associated with this item manager unless the method specification states otherwise.

    Team repository objects are intended to be used by multi-threaded clients. Unless noted, the methods on ITeamRepository and its various subsidiaries, including IItemManager, can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently without risk of corruption.

    Since:
    0.5

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT
      Constant (value 0) indicating default options for fetching an item.
      static int REFRESH
      Bit-mask flags constant (value 1 << 0) indicating the current state of the item in the repository is to be used if more recent than the state known to this item manager.
      static int UNSHARED
      Bit-mask flags constant (value 1 << 1) indicating that the item manager's pool of shared items should be completely bypassed.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT

        static final int DEFAULT
        Constant (value 0) indicating default options for fetching an item. The default is to return a shared item, and to not contact the server if a recent current state of the the item is already known to the item manager.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItem(IItemHandle, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchCompleteItems(List, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItem(IItemHandle, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItems(List, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor), Constant Field Values

      • REFRESH

        static final int REFRESH
        Bit-mask flags constant (value 1 << 0) indicating the current state of the item in the repository is to be used if more recent than the state known to this item manager. When REFRESH is specified, the server is always contacted. The default is to not refresh.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItem(IItemHandle, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchCompleteItems(List, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItem(IItemHandle, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItems(List, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor), Constant Field Values

      • UNSHARED

        static final int UNSHARED
        Bit-mask flags constant (value 1 << 1) indicating that the item manager's pool of shared items should be completely bypassed. When UNSHARED is specified, the server is always contacted. The current state of the item is retrieved from the server and returned; an existing shared item is neither used nor updated. The default is to use a shared item.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItem(IItemHandle, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchCompleteItems(List, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItem(IItemHandle, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItems(List, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor), Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • teamRepository

        ITeamRepository teamRepository()
        Returns the repository associated with this manager. The client need not be logged in to the repository.
        Returns:
        the repository, which is never null
        See Also:
        ITeamRepository.itemManager()

      • fetchCompleteItem

        IItem fetchCompleteItem(IItemHandle itemHandle,
                      int flags,
                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                        throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the current state of the item with the specified item type and item id; the resulting item is complete (has all its properties). The flags parameter controls whether the result is a shared item, and whether the result is perfectly in sync with the current state in the repository.

        The method is equivalent to fetchCompleteItems(Collections.singletonList(itemHandle), flags, monitor) except that it throws an exception if the item was not found.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemHandle - the item handle giving the item id and item type of the desired item; must not be null
        flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify IItemManager.DEFAULT to get a shared item (recommended) that tracks the current state of the item; specify IItemManager.REFRESH to ensure that the shared item is up-to-date; specify IItemManager.UNSHARED to return the current state of the item not as a shared item (and without affecting the shared item if one exists)
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the complete item for the given item handle; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item was not found
        PermissionDeniedException - if the current user does not have permission to read the item
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        fetchPartialItem(IItemHandle, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor), fetchCompleteItems(List, int, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchCompleteItem

        IItem fetchCompleteItem(Location location,
                      int flags,
                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                        throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the current state of the item with the specified Location; the resulting item is complete (has all its properties). The flags parameter controls whether the result is a shared item, and whether the result is perfectly in sync with the current state in the repository.

        This method is exactly equivalent to fetchCompleteItem(IItemHandle, int, IProgressMonitor) if the referenced Location caches an ItemHandle. However, if the Location does not cache an ItemHandle, this method assumes that the Location is a "named" Location, and will unconditionally contact the server to resolve the Location to a handle, and then update the local cache according to the values specified in flags. If the specified itemType in the named location does not have a named attribute, a TeamRepositoryException is thrown.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        location - the location identifying the jazz item - must be auditable or simple; must not be null. May be named or oid-based, relative or absolute. If absolute, any specified repository or service information is ignored.
        flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify IItemManager.DEFAULT to get a shared item (recommended) that tracks the current state of the item, but only if the referenced Location caches an ItemHandle - otherwise the repository is contacted unconditionally; specify IItemManager.REFRESH to ensure that the shared item is up-to-date - if the referenced Location does not cache an ItemHandle, the repository is contacted unconditionally; specify IItemManager.UNSHARED to return the current state of the item not as a shared item (and without affecting the shared item if one exists).
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the complete item for the given item handle; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item was not found
        PermissionDeniedException - if the current user does not have permission to read the item
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItem(IItemHandle, int, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchCompleteItems

        java.util.List fetchCompleteItems(java.util.List itemHandles,
                                int flags,
                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the current state of the items with the specified item type and item id; the resulting items are complete (have all their properties). The flags parameter controls whether the result is a shared item, and whether the result is perfectly in sync with the current state in the repository.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemHandles - a list of simple or auditable item handles (element type: IItemHandle) giving the item ids and item types of the desired items; must not be null, nor contain null elements; multiple elements for the same item are tolerated
        flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify IItemManager.DEFAULT to get a shared item (recommended) that tracks the current state of the item; specify IItemManager.REFRESH to ensure that the shared item is up-to-date; specify IItemManager.UNSHARED to return the current state of the item not as a shared item (and without affecting the shared item if one exists)
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a list of items (element type: IItem) paralleling itemHandles, with null elements corresponding to items that were not found; list itself is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItem(IItemHandle, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchCompleteItemsPermissionAware(List, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItems(List, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchCompleteItemsPermissionAware

        IFetchResult fetchCompleteItemsPermissionAware(java.util.List itemHandles,
                                             int flags,
                                             org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                               throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the current state of the items with the specified item type and item id; the resulting items are complete (have all their properties). The flags parameter controls whether the result is a shared item, and whether the result is perfectly in sync with the current state in the repository.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemHandles - a list of simple or auditable item handles (element type: IItemHandle) giving the item ids and item types of the desired items; must not be null, nor contain null elements; multiple elements for the same item are tolerated
        flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify IItemManager.DEFAULT to get a shared item (recommended) that tracks the current state of the item; specify IItemManager.REFRESH to ensure that the shared item is up-to-date; specify IItemManager.UNSHARED to return the current state of the item not as a shared item (and without affecting the shared item if one exists)
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a result object containing a possibly-empty list of retrieved items (IFetchResult.getRetrievedItems(), element type: IItem), along with a possibly-empty list of item handles for items that were not found in the repository (IFetchResult.getNotFoundItems(), element type: IItemHandle) and a possibly-empty list of items that the user did not have permission to read (IFetchResult.getPermissionDeniedItems(), element type: IItemHandle); never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        Since:
        0.7
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItem(IItemHandle, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchCompleteItems(List, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItems(List, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchCompleteItemsByLocation

        java.util.List fetchCompleteItemsByLocation(java.util.List locations,
                                          int flags,
                                          org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                            throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the current state of the items identified by the specified locations; the resulting items are complete (have all their properties). The flags parameter controls whether the result is a shared item, and whether the result is perfectly in sync with the current state in the repository.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        locations - a list of locations (element type: Location) identifying Jazz resources. Must not be null, nor contain null elements. While only locations that identify IItem will resolve, locations to non-Item or non-Jazz resources are tolerated.
        flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify IItemManager.DEFAULT to get a shared item (recommended) that tracks the current state of the item; specify IItemManager.REFRESH to ensure that the shared item is up-to-date; specify IItemManager.UNSHARED to return the current state of the item not as a shared item (and without affecting the shared item if one exists)
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a list of items (element type: IItem) paralleling locations, with null elements corresponding to items that were not found or locations that could not be resolved; list itself is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItem(Location, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchCompleteItemsByLocationPermissionAware(List, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItemsByLocation(List, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchCompleteItemsByLocationPermissionAware

        IFetchResult fetchCompleteItemsByLocationPermissionAware(java.util.List locations,
                                                       int flags,
                                                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                         throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the current state of the items identified by the specified locations; the resulting items are complete (have all their properties). The flags parameter controls whether the result is a shared item, and whether the result is perfectly in sync with the current state in the repository.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        locations - a list of locations (element type: Location) identifying Jazz resources. Must not be null, nor contain null elements. While only locations that identify IItem will resolve, locations to non-Item or non-Jazz resources are tolerated.
        flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify IItemManager.DEFAULT to get a shared item (recommended) that tracks the current state of the item; specify IItemManager.REFRESH to ensure that the shared item is up-to-date; specify IItemManager.UNSHARED to return the current state of the item not as a shared item (and without affecting the shared item if one exists)
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a result object containing a possibly-empty list of retrieved items (IFetchResult.getRetrievedItems(), element type: IItem), along with a possibly-empty list of item locations for items that were not found in the repository (IFetchResult.getNotFoundItems(), element type: Location) and a possibly-empty list of locations that the user did not have permission to read (IFetchResult.getPermissionDeniedItems(), element type: Location); never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        Since:
        0.7
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItem(Location, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchCompleteItemsByLocation(List, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItemsByLocation(List, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchPartialItem

        IItem fetchPartialItem(IItemHandle itemHandle,
                     int flags,
                     java.util.Collection requiredProperties,
                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                       throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the current state of the item with the specified item type and item id; the resulting item may be partial, but will have at least the given list of properties. The flags parameter controls whether the result is a shared item, and whether the result is perfectly in sync with the current state in the repository.

        The method is equivalent to fetchPartialItems(Collections.singletonList(itemHandle), flags, requiredProperties, monitor) except that it throws an exception if the item was not found.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemHandle - the item handle giving the item id and item type of the desired item; must not be null
        requiredProperties - the list of names of item properties (element type: String); the strings must be valid property names for the item type of itemHandle; duplicate property names are tolerated; null means use the defaults for the item type
        flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify IItemManager.DEFAULT to get a shared item (recommended) that tracks the current state of the item; specify IItemManager.REFRESH to ensure that the shared item is up-to-date; specify IItemManager.UNSHARED to return the current state of the item not as a shared item (and without affecting the shared item if one exists)
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the possibly-partial item for the given item handle; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item was not found
        PermissionDeniedException - if the current user does not have permission to read the item
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItem(IItemHandle, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItems(List, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchPartialItem

        IItem fetchPartialItem(Location location,
                     int flags,
                     java.util.Collection requiredProperties,
                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                       throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the current state of the item identified by the referenced location; the resulting item may be partial, but will have at least the given list of properties. The flags parameter controls whether the result is a shared item, and whether the result is perfectly in sync with the current state in the repository.

        The location must refer to an auditable or simple item, and may be oid-based or named, relative or absolute.

        If the location is named and has no associated item handle the server is unconditionally contacted to retrieve the specified properties.

        The method is equivalent to fetchPartialItem(IItemHandle, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor) except that it uses a Location to specify the requested item.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        location - the location identifying the auditable or simple item to retrieve properties on. May be relative or absolute, oid or named. Must not be null. If absolute, any specified repository or service information is ignored.
        requiredProperties - the list of names of item properties (element type: String); the strings must be valid property names for the item type of location; duplicate property names are tolerated; null means use the defaults for the item type
        flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify IItemManager.DEFAULT to get a shared item (recommended) that tracks the current state of the item; specify IItemManager.REFRESH to ensure that the shared item is up-to-date; specify IItemManager.UNSHARED to return the current state of the item not as a shared item (and without affecting the shared item if one exists)
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the possibly-partial item for the given item handle; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item was not found
        PermissionDeniedException - if the current user does not have permission to read the item
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItem(IItemHandle, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItems(List, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchPartialItems

        java.util.List fetchPartialItems(java.util.List itemHandles,
                               int flags,
                               java.util.Collection requiredProperties,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                 throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the current state of the items with the specified item type and item id; the resulting items may be partial, but will have at least the given list of properties. The flags parameter controls whether the result is a shared item, and whether the result is perfectly in sync with the current state in the repository.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemHandles - a list of simple or auditable item handles (element type: IItemHandle) giving the item ids and item types of the desired items; must not be null, nor contain null elements; all items must be of the same type; multiple elements for the same item are tolerated
        flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify IItemManager.DEFAULT to get a shared item (recommended) that tracks the current state of the item; specify IItemManager.REFRESH to ensure that the shared item is up-to-date; specify IItemManager.UNSHARED to return the current state of the item not as a shared item (and without affecting the shared item if one exists)
        requiredProperties - the list of names of item properties (element type: String); the strings must be valid property names for the item type of itemHandles; duplicate property names are tolerated; null means use the defaults for the item type
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a list items (element type: IItem) paralleling itemHandles, with null elements corresponding to items that were not found; list itself is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItems(List, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItem(IItemHandle, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItemsPermissionAware(List, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchPartialItemsPermissionAware

        IFetchResult fetchPartialItemsPermissionAware(java.util.List itemHandles,
                                            int flags,
                                            java.util.Collection requiredProperties,
                                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                              throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the current state of the items with the specified item type and item id; the resulting items may be partial, but will have at least the given list of properties. The flags parameter controls whether the result is a shared item, and whether the result is perfectly in sync with the current state in the repository.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemHandles - a list of simple or auditable item handles (element type: IItemHandle) giving the item ids and item types of the desired items; must not be null, nor contain null elements; all items must be of the same type; multiple elements for the same item are tolerated
        flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify IItemManager.DEFAULT to get a shared item (recommended) that tracks the current state of the item; specify IItemManager.REFRESH to ensure that the shared item is up-to-date; specify IItemManager.UNSHARED to return the current state of the item not as a shared item (and without affecting the shared item if one exists)
        requiredProperties - the list of names of item properties (element type: String); the strings must be valid property names for the item type of itemHandles; duplicate property names are tolerated; null means use the defaults for the item type
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a result object containing a possibly-empty list of retrieved items (IFetchResult.getRetrievedItems(), element type: IItem), along with a possibly-empty list of item handles for items that were not found in the repository (IFetchResult.getNotFoundItems(), element type: IItemHandle) and a possibly-empty list of items that the user did not have permission to read (IFetchResult.getPermissionDeniedItems(), element type: IItemHandle); never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        Since:
        0.7
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteItems(List, int, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItem(IItemHandle, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialItems(List, int, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchPartialItemsByLocation

        java.util.List fetchPartialItemsByLocation(java.util.List locations,
                                         int flags,
                                         java.util.Collection requiredProperties,
                                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                           throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the current state of the items identified by the specified locations; the resulting items may be partial, but will have at least the given list of properties. The flags parameter controls whether the result is a shared item, and whether the result is perfectly in sync with the current state in the repository.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        locations - a list of locations (element type: Location) identifying Jazz resources. Must not be null, nor contain null elements. While only locations that identify IItem will resolve, locations to non-Item or non-Jazz resources are tolerated.
        flags - bit-wise OR of the constants declared on this interface; specify IItemManager.DEFAULT to get a shared item (recommended) that tracks the current state of the item; specify IItemManager.REFRESH to ensure that the shared item is up-to-date; specify IItemManager.UNSHARED to return the current state of the item not as a shared item (and without affecting the shared item if one exists)
        requiredProperties - the list of names of item properties (element type: String); the strings must be valid property names for the item type of locations; duplicate property names are tolerated; null means use the defaults for the item type
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a list items (element type: IItem) paralleling locations, with null elements corresponding to items that were not found; list itself is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:

      • fetchCompleteState

        IAuditable fetchCompleteState(IAuditableHandle itemHandle,
                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                              throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the specified state of the item with the specified item type and item id and state id; the resulting item is complete (has all its properties).

        The method is equivalent to fetchCompleteStates(Collections.singletonList(itemHandle), monitor) except that it throws an exception if the item state was not found.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemHandle - the item handle with a state id; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the immutable item state; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item or item state was not found
        PermissionDeniedException - if the current user does not have permission to read the item
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteStates(List, IProgressMonitor), #fetchPartialState(IItemHandle, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchCompleteState

        IAuditable fetchCompleteState(Location location,
                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                              throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the specified state of the item as identified by the referenced location; the resulting item is complete (has all its properties).

        The method is equivalent to fetchCompleteState(IAuditableHandle, IProgressMonitor) except that the auditable state to retrieve is identified by location. That location must be an oid-based location that identifies a specific state of an auditable.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        location - an oid-based location referencing a specific state of an auditable; must not be null; may be relative or absolute. If absolute, any specified repository or service information is ignored.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the immutable item state; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item or item state was not found
        PermissionDeniedException - if the current user does not have permission to read the item
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteStates(List, IProgressMonitor), #fetchPartialState(IItemHandle, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchCompleteStates

        java.util.List fetchCompleteStates(java.util.List itemHandles,
                                 org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the specified state of the item with the specified item types and item ids and state ids; the resulting items are complete (have all their properties). The list may include items of different types, and multiple states of the same item.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemHandles - a list of auditable item handles (element type: IAuditableHandle) giving the item types, item ids, and state ids of the desired items; must not be null, nor contain null elements; multiple elements for the same item state are tolerated
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a list of complete, immutable item states (element type: IItem) paralleling itemHandles, with null elements corresponding to items that were not found; list itself is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        #fetchCompleteState(IItemHandle, IProgressMonitor), fetchCompleteStatesPermissionAware(List, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialStates(List, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

        Retrieves the specified state of the item with the specified item type and item id and state id; the resulting item may be partial, but will have at least the given list of properties.

        The method is equivalent to fetchPartialStates(Collections.singletonList(itemHandle), requiredProperties, monitor) except that it throws an exception if the item state was not found.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

      • fetchPartialState

        IAuditable fetchPartialState(Location location,
                           java.util.Collection requiredProperties,
                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                             throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the specified state of the item identified by the specified location; the resulting item may be partial, but will have at least the given list of properties.

        The specified location must be oid-based, specifying a specific state of an auditable. It may be relative or absolute.

        The method is equivalent to fetchPartialState(IAuditableHandle, Collection, IProgressMonitor) except that it uses a Location to specified the auditable to retrieve properties on.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        location - the oid-based location specifying a specific state of an auditable; may be relative or absolute; must not be null. If absolute, any repository or service information specified is ignored.
        requiredProperties - the list of names of item properties (element type: String); the strings must be valid property names for the item type of itemHandle; duplicate property names are tolerated; null means use the defaults for the item type
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an immutable item state with at least the specified properties; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item or item state was not found
        PermissionDeniedException - if the current user does not have permission to read the item
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        #fetchCompleteState(IItemHandle, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialStates(List, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • fetchPartialStates

        java.util.List fetchPartialStates(java.util.List itemHandles,
                                java.util.Collection requiredProperties,
                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the specified state of the item with the specified item types and item ids and state ids; the resulting items may be partial, but will have at least the given list of properties. All items must be of the same type, but the list may include multiple states of the same item.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemHandles - a list of auditable or versioanble item handles (element type: IItemHandle) giving the item ids and item types of the desired items; must not be null, nor contain null elements; all items must be of the same type; multiple elements for the same item state are tolerated
        requiredProperties - the list of names of item properties (element type: String); the strings must be valid property names for the item type of itemHandle; duplicate property names are tolerated; null means use the defaults for the item type
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a list of immutable item states (element type: IItem) with at least the specified properties, paralleling itemHandles, with null elements corresponding to items that were not found; list itself is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        See Also:
        fetchCompleteStates(List, IProgressMonitor), #fetchPartialState(IItemHandle, Collection, IProgressMonitor), fetchPartialStatesPermissionAware(List, Collection, IProgressMonitor)

                                             java.util.Collection requiredProperties,
                                             org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                               throws TeamRepositoryException

        requiredProperties - the list of names of item properties (element type: String); the strings must be valid property names for the item type of itemHandle; duplicate property names are tolerated; null means use the defaults for the item type

      • fetchAllStateHandles

        java.util.List fetchAllStateHandles(IAuditableHandle itemHandle,
                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                    throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the full history of the given auditable item. The auditable item states retrieved as part of the resulting history object are complete states. The operation fails if the client is not logged in to the repository.

        The item states in the result are considered immutable. The client must not attempt to modify any of these item states.

        Parameters:
        itemHandle - the auditable handle; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the history of the auditable containing all states (element type: IAuditableHandle) of the given item known to the repository; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the item was not found
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • refreshSharedItems

        void refreshSharedItems(java.util.List sharedItems,
                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                        throws TeamRepositoryException
        Updates the given shared items to their current states in the repository. The item type must be either simple or auditable. The shared items must be known to this item manager.

        Listeners are notified of changes to the shared items. If an item has been deleted from the repository, this method returns normally and listeners will be notified of the item deletion.

        This method does basically the same things as either fetchCompleteItems fetchPartialItems specifying REFRESH and requiresProperties determined by the shared item itself. All properties that are currently set in the shared item get refreshed.

        Parameters:
        sharedItems - a list of shared item (element type: IItem), which all must belong to this item manager; must not be null, nor contain null elements; duplicate shared items are tolerated
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • getSharedItemIfKnown

        IItem getSharedItemIfKnown(IItemHandle itemHandle)
        Returns the existing shared item for the item with the specified item type and item id. The item type must be either simple or auditable. Returns null if this item manager does not currently have a shared item for the given id. The server is not contacted. Note that the resulting shared item may be partial.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemHandle - the item handle giving the item id and item type (simple or auditable) of the item for which the existing shared item is desired; must not be null
        Returns:
        the possibly-partial shared item for the given item handle, or null if the item is not known to this item manager
        See Also:
        getKnownSharedItems(IItemType)

      • getKnownSharedItems

        java.util.List getKnownSharedItems(IItemType itemType)
        Returns all existing shared items of the given item type known to this item manager. The item type must be either simple or auditable. The server is not contacted. Note that the individual shared items returned may be complete or partial.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemType - the item type (simple or auditable) of the items for which existing shared items are desired; must not be null
        Returns:
        a possibly-empty list of possibly-partial shared items; never null; subsequent changes to this item manager do not affect the returned list; the caller can safely traverse or manipulate the list
        See Also:
        getSharedItemIfKnown(IItemHandle)

      • getImmutableState

        IItem getImmutableState(IItem sharedItem)
        Returns an immutable item state matching the current state of the given item if shared or null if the item is not shared. By shared item, it is meant an item that was known to this item manager. A shared item that has been deleted from the repository is still a shared item. The server is not contacted. Note that the resulting item state may be partial.

        The resulting item state is considered immutable. The client must not attempt to modify the item state.

        The items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        sharedItem - the potentially shared item; must not be null
        Returns:
        a possibly-partial immutable item state or null if the passed item is not shared.

      • applyItemUpdates

        java.util.List applyItemUpdates(java.util.List itemStates)
        Applies the given item states to updated this item manager and returns the corresponding shared items in the cases where this updating was possible. The item types must be either simple or auditable. Each item state must be a recent current state of the item in the repository no older than the state the item manager already knows about for the item. If the item manager has a shared item for an item, the given item state is used to update it or upgrade it as required. If not, the item manager creates a new shared item and initializes it with the properties from the given item state. Returns the corresponding shared item if the item state is accepted.

        If a given item state is partial, the item manager may reject it if it does not meet minimum standards for partial items of that item type. In that case, the shared item is not updated, and the method returns a null element in the corresponding position. The item manager never rejects complete item states. The companion method, applyItemUpdatesOrRefresh(List, IProgressMonitor), encapsulates deal with rejections by making additional server round trips.

        Listeners are notified of any changes to the shared items.

        This method is intended to be used by client library.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemStates - a list of complete or partial item states (element type: IItem); no null elements; multiple states for the same item are not allowed; list itself must not be null
        Returns:
        a list of shared items (element type: IItem) paralleling itemStates, with null elements corresponding to item states that were rejected; list itself is never null
        See Also:
        applyItemUpdatesOrRefresh(List, IProgressMonitor)

      • applyItemUpdatesOrRefresh

        java.util.List applyItemUpdatesOrRefresh(java.util.List itemStates,
                                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                         throws TeamRepositoryException
        Applies the given item states to updated this item manager and returns the corresponding shared items. The item types must be either simple or auditable. Each item state must be a recent current state of the item in the repository no older than the state the item manager already knows about for the item. If the item manager has a shared item for an item, the given item state is used to update it or upgrade it as required. If not, the item manager creates a new shared item and initializes it with the properties from the given item state. Returns the corresponding shared items.

        Unlike applyItemUpdates(List), this method automatically handles cases where additional server round trips are required to update or upgrade the shared item (i.e., when the given item state is partial and does not meet minimum standards for shared items of that item type).

        Listeners are notified of any changes to the shared items.

        This method is intended to be used by client library.

        Items returned by this method will have their origin set to the repository associated with this manager.

        Parameters:
        itemStates - a list of complete or partial item states (element type: IItem); no null elements; multiple states for the same item are not allowed; list itself must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a list of shared items (element type: IItem) paralleling itemStates; list itself is never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong

      • applyItemDeletes

        void applyItemDeletes(java.util.List itemHandles)
        Informs this item manager that the given items have been deleted from the repository. The item types must be either simple or auditable. If the item manager has a shared item for an item, all interested listeners are notified of the item's deletion. This method does not create any new shared items.

        This method is intended to be used by client library.

        Usage note: This method does not directly delete a shared item from the item manager. Rather, it tells listeners that the item has gone away. Hopefully, they respond by dropping any references they have to the shared item. If everyone does this, the shared item will be freed up and eventually GC'd.

        Parameters:
        itemHandles - a list of item handle (element type: IItemHandle); no null elements or duplicates; list itself must not be null

      • applyItemUpdatesAndDeletes

        java.util.List applyItemUpdatesAndDeletes(java.util.List itemStatesToUpdate,
                                        java.util.List itemHandlesToDelete)
        Applies the given item states to updated this item manager, informs this item manager that the given items have been deleted from the repository and returns the corresponding shared items. This method is equivalent to calling both applyItemUpdates(List) and applyItemDeletes(List) but has the advantage of grouping all the resulting events.
        Parameters:
        itemStatesToUpdate - a list of complete or partial item states (element type: IItem); no null elements; multiple states for the same item are not allowed; list itself must not be null
        itemHandlesToDelete - a list of item handle (element type: IItemHandle); no null elements or duplicates; list itself must not be null
        Returns:
        a list of shared items (element type: IItem) paralleling itemStates, with null elements corresponding to item states that were rejected; list itself is never null
        See Also:
        applyItemUpdates(List), applyItemDeletes(List)

      • addItemChangeListener

        void addItemChangeListener(IItem sharedItem,
                         ISharedItemChangeListener listener)
        Registers a listener with this item manager for events involving the given shared item. The item type must be either simple or auditable. Has no effect of the identical listener is already registered against the given shared item. The client need not be logged in to the repository.

        The client may register the same listener instance against multiple item types and individual items. However, it is the client's responsibility to keep track of such things, and deregister the listener when it is no longer needed. Failing to do so leaks the listener object, which is hung on to by the item manager. Even more seriously, the listener wastes time because it continues to receive event notifications in perpetuity.

        By registering a listener against a particular shared item, the shared item will remain in the item manager even if the client drops all other references to the item. This makes it even more critical that these listeners be deregistered when the item is no longer of interest.

        Calling the method purgeItemChangeListener(ISharedItemChangeListener) will deregister the change listener for all item types and for all items.

        The item must be a shared item known to this item manager.

        Parameters:
        sharedItem - the shared item of interest; must not be null
        listener - the listener; must not be null
        See Also:
        removeItemChangeListener(IItem, ISharedItemChangeListener)

      • removeItemChangeListener

        void removeItemChangeListener(IItem sharedItem,
                            ISharedItemChangeListener listener)
        Deregisters a listener with this item manager for the given shared item. The item type must be either simple or auditable. Has no effect if the listener is not registered against the given shared item. The client need not be logged in to the repository.
        Parameters:
        sharedItem - the shared item of interest; must not be null
        listener - the listener; must not be null
        See Also:
        addItemChangeListener(IItem, ISharedItemChangeListener)

      • addItemChangeListener

        void addItemChangeListener(IItemType itemType,
                         ISharedItemChangeListener listener)
        Registers a listener with this item manager for events involving any item of the given item type. The item type must be either simple or auditable. Has no effect of the identical listener is already registered against this item type. The client need not be logged in to the repository.

        The client may register the same listener instance against multiple item types and individual items. However, it is the client's responsibility to keep track of such things, and deregister the listener when it is no longer needed. Failing to do so leaks the listener object, which is hung on to by the item manager. Even more seriously, the listener wastes time because it continues to receive event notifications in perpetuity.

        Calling the method purgeItemChangeListener(ISharedItemChangeListener) will deregister the change listener for all item types and for all items.

        Parameters:
        itemType - the item type of interest; must be a simple item type or an auditable item type; must not be null
        listener - the listener; must not be null
        See Also:
        removeItemChangeListener(IItemType, ISharedItemChangeListener)

      • removeItemChangeListener

        void removeItemChangeListener(IItemType itemType,
                            ISharedItemChangeListener listener)
        Deregisters a listener with this item manager for the given item type. The item type must be either simple or auditable. Has no effect if the listener is not registered against the given item type. The client need not be logged in to the repository.
        Parameters:
        itemType - the item type of interest; must be a simple item type or an auditable item type; must not be null
        listener - the listener; must not be null
        See Also:
        addItemChangeListener(IItemType, ISharedItemChangeListener)

      • purgeItemChangeListener

        void purgeItemChangeListener(ISharedItemChangeListener listener)
        Deregisters a listener previously registered with this item manager, whether registered against item types or against individual items. Has no effect if the listener is not registered with this item manager. The client need not be logged in to the repository.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener; must not be null
